page.title: 01Aregleoch Forest Main Block
page.content: This whole area is totally afforested and contains forest from just newly planted up to planted in 1958. Sqs 1 & 5 are privately owned the rest being owned by the forest Commission. This area contains some of the richest ground in the whole forest for afforestation and some of te most sheltered. The area slso contains an ancient Bronze age village which has been left undestrubed and has been fenced off and a site of special scientific interest. Once again the area could be described as glacial upland topography having a very reasonably fertile peaty grey soil type. The area is quite exposed although the ground in and around the ancient village is sheltered and contains the best and richest soils of the whole forest. The village can be found in centre of Sq 7.
